page.title: 14RECREATION
page.content: In the Little Parndon area of the new town much of the space is given over to recreation, with a children's play area (one of the very many in Harlow), two rugby pitches used by the local amateur rugby teams and Canons Brook Golf Course. The eighteen-hole course was leased to the Harlow and District Sports Trust on a 99-years lease and now has 70 years to go. It was designed by Henry Cotton and completed in 1964. An old farm building on the site was converted into the club house and the course was officially opened in 1966.
